citation.title: HUMAN ACTIVITY MEDIATES A TROPHIC CASCADE CAUSED BY WOLVES

facebook.summary: If you want a healthy ecosystem then you need apex predators. Nowhere has this been made more apparent than in Yellowstone National Park. The last wolf was killed in the park in 1926. For nearly 70 years, the park was devoid of these apex predators until 1

wikipedia.title: Mesopredator release hypothesis
wikipedia.summary: The mesopredator release hypothesis is an ecological theory used to describe the interrelated population dynamics between apex predators and mesopredators within an ecosystem, such that a collapsing population of the former results in dramatically-increase

author.name: 🦊Andrew Butler🦊
author.description: MS Wildlife Biology candidate in the #CUPrairieLab studying swift foxes in Montana. @COLSA_UNH '11 BS Zoology. Loves college hockey.
